greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A binary encoding of the zeros in base-4 representation of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65536
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
mathematica: Table[FromDigits[IntegerDigits[n, 4] /. k_ /; IntegerQ@ k :> If[k == 0, 1, 0], 2], {n, 0, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 21 2017 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A292370 n) (if (zero? n) n (let loop ((n n) (b 1) (s 0)) (if (< n 4) s (let ((d (modulo n 4))) (if (zero? d) (loop (/ n 4) (+ b b) (+ s b)) (loop (/ (- n d) 4) (+ b b) s)))))))
return 0 if n==0 else int("".join(['1' if i==0 else '0' for i in k]), 2)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 15 2017
